creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Adam seated at L below tree; Eve at R reaching up to receive a piece of fruit from a snake in a tree; with her opposite hand, Eve is handing another fruit to Adam; animals resting in background behind Eve
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp, Label

-- numbered in plate at lower right: [2]
-- label on front of mat: Sotheby\'s New York 1168 / 5691
-- in graphite on mat: 2/27/88 sale at Sotheby\'s
-- in pen on mat: From the Collection: Fr. von Hagens Düsseldorf, 1927, stamp

Pen and ink German inscription glued to inside of mat.
markings: on verso: violet stamp, upper left, Franz von Hagens (Lugt 1052a); superimposed red and blue stamps, lower left, Albert W. Blum (Lugt 79b and Lugt 3198); on mat: black stamp, Blum (Lugt 79b); Sotheby\'s label
provenance: Franz von Hagens (1817-1899), Dresden, sale 1927; Albert W. Blum (until February 27, 1988; his sale, Sotheby's, New York, no. 1168; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, upper left: [1541 / AG]
title: The Fall of Mankind, From the Dance of Death (Das Totentanz), Plate 2
